I used the link provided by PLAYZONE to download and got a happy 400kb/sec avg speed.  1hr 15min to download.

Installs fine but I'm having problems playing it.  I checked my PC spec on systemrequirementslab.com and weas told I flew past the minimum requirements but failed the recommended.  I d'loaded anyway as it should still play but the graphics are messed up big time.  In the plane in the 1st scene I can only see the characters' eyes, nothing else. When freefalling I can see nothing even with night vision on.

My PC spec is:

E6750 running at 2 x 3.2Ghz
Nvidia 7600GT running at 725/800
Windows XP SP2
Creative Audigy 2ZS Sound Card
Newest Drivers installed

This is either down to a fault in the demo or my graphics card, but it should run fine on all low settings.  Damn, was really looking forward to this.
Try the lastest nvidia beta drivers Evil__Homer, "recommended driver for crysis single player demo" http://www.nvidia.com/object/winxp_169.01.html

GaGaG - Cheers for the advice - Didn't solve my problem on it's own but certainly helped. I found I had to put all graphics settings up to High before I could get any sort of picture.  After the settings had re-loaded, I could then drop it back to medium where necessary to get a decent frame rate.

RAINSTICK - I reckon it's just a very temperamental demo - seems to work fine on some real low setups, but won't work on higher ones.  Seen lots of forums out there with ppl listing problems.

As for the game - I wasn't overly impressed - Just seems to be a tarted up version of Far Cry.  Infact, I think I might re-install that and play through it again!
